channel.title: How To Pack .rscd
channel.description:
when you use the sprite editor. how do you repack the animation .xml?
If i unpack animation.rscd the unpack folder doesnt show any files just folders2 if i just edit the .xml and compress it then how the hell do i get it to .rscd animation

item.title: How To Pack .rscd
item.dc:creator: @Exhale_Loud Exhale Loud
item.description:
@Exhale_Loud wrote:

Yea Dragon is already in animation.rscd i just checked so im really stuck.

I know for a fact the problem is itemwieldable. Because everything works fine but when i go to wield it puts on a blue skirt thats offset when
i turn my camera angel. What INT should i put the Dragon item below in itemwieldable? and what INT number should i give it?

There are like 5+ items underneath the scythe. If i insert the dragon below those in itemwieldable then it shows up as OAK LOG CERTS.
(which is the next item under the scythe)
So i try putting the dragon item below the scythe in itemwieldable and it shows up, but when i wield it it puts on a skirt usually.

Also by moving the dragon items underneath the scythe, then i have to move it there in the items.def and items.rscd or it wont show
so they all have to be under the same item for it to show.

Read full topic

item.title: How To Pack .rscd
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

The dragon stuff is already implemented. All you have to do is make entries to the ItemWieldableDef XML for their ID.

Read full topic

item.title: How To Pack .rscd
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“Exhale Loud, post:18, topic:440745”]i noticed that the dragon items in the itemdef.xml and wieldable.xml were underneath the red spider eggs
That means the ID cant be 1290-1291. So i put them underneath the scythe which is 1289.

So… i made the INT of the dragon 2h 1290 and the dragon chain INT to 1291 and placed those dragon items under the scythe in all the itemwieldable & itemdef (this still did not work) – items make me got invisible or wear a skirt or give me a beard when i wield.

So i put the dragon items back underneath red spider eggs and put the dragon 2h INT to 1329 and the dragon chain INT to 1330 and the items turned into certs
I also tried putting the INT to 1290 and 1291 with the dragon items underneath spider eggs
And with every combo i tried i put the items.rscd dragon items underneath the red spider eggs and scythe to match the xml’s but it didnt work

i tried 1000 times for the past about 4+ hours.
If this has to do with animation.rscd then i dont know what to do. I tried copying the last sword animation duplicating it and changing the mask
to the dragon color but then it gives me a wizhard or some other crazy item when i wield

D2h = sprite 82 type = 8216
Dchain = sprite 7 type = 4[/quote]
Did u create a new animation for those? Via Animations.rscd.

Read full topic

item.title: How To Pack .rscd
item.dc:creator: @Exhale_Loud Exhale Loud
item.description:
@Exhale_Loud wrote:

i noticed that the dragon items in the itemdef.xml and wieldable.xml were underneath the red spider eggs
That means the ID cant be 1290-1291. So i put them underneath the scythe which is 1289.

So… i made the INT of the dragon 2h 1290 and the dragon chain INT to 1291 and placed those dragon items under the scythe in all the itemwieldable & itemdef (this still did not work) – items make me got invisible or wear a skirt or give me a beard when i wield.

So i put the dragon items back underneath red spider eggs and put the dragon 2h INT to 1329 and the dragon chain INT to 1330 and the items turned into certs
I also tried putting the INT to 1290 and 1291 with the dragon items underneath spider eggs
And with every combo i tried i put the items.rscd dragon items underneath the red spider eggs and scythe to match the xml’s but it didnt work

i tried 1000 times for the past about 4+ hours.
If this has to do with animation.rscd then i dont know what to do. I tried copying the last sword animation duplicating it and changing the mask
to the dragon color but then it gives me a wizhard or some other crazy item when i wield

D2h = sprite 82 type = 8216
Dchain = sprite 7 type = 4

Read full topic

item.title: How To Pack .rscd
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

You dont need to post the entire xml document, just the part your adding.

Also wieldable items have a seperate xml file server sided… itemwieldable.xml or something like that. It controls the animations if I recall…

Read full topic

item.title: How To Pack .rscd
item.dc:creator: @Exhale_Loud Exhale Loud
item.description:
@Exhale_Loud wrote:

omgz thanks for all the help!

Ok so bassically the XML already had the dragon armor in it. So i paste it all into the client item.rscd
so the only added is the bottom stuff after Red spider eggs

item.RSCD (client)

item.title: How To Pack .rscd
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

add it client sided in items.rscd

the id will be the placement of the item.

http://jamili.da3rx.com/rsc/items.html

after 1289… its all custom.

item.title: How To Pack .rscd
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

Also, it’s quite handy to load the existing sprite and check out the values, then use them for your new sprite, but keep in mind that the new sprite must be exactly same size.

Read full topic

item.title: How To Pack .rscd
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

Load each image (png) into the editor, modify the stats, xShift, yShift etc and then save it as .spr. You’ll also have to save it as the same file name as the original image, just different file extension.

Read full topic

item.title: How To Pack .rscd
item.dc:creator: @Exhale_Loud Exhale Loud
item.description:
@Exhale_Loud wrote:

lol thats really doesnt answer my question.

I took all the .png images of a bow and colored them in photoshop. So now what do i do?
Do i open each bow and save it over the original .png’s
Load each custom bow in the sprite editor and save it over the original .png’s
or
open load each .png into the sprite editor and save it over the .spr files

Read full topic

item.title: How To Pack .rscd
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

Just save the .spr as that is what’s packed back into the sprites.rscd.

Read full topic

item.title: How To Pack .rscd
item.dc:creator: @Exhale_Loud Exhale Loud
item.description:
@Exhale_Loud wrote:

  1. Do i save the .png and the .scr
  2. Or just edit the .png then open it in the Editor and save it as .scr

Read full topic

item.title: How To Pack .rscd
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

Once you have your edited images, load them in the editor, modify the dimensions accordingly (x and y shift, etc), save it as an .spr in the ‘sprite’ folder and then pack them into your Sprites.rscd.

Read full topic

item.title: How To Pack .rscd
item.dc:creator: @Exhale_Loud Exhale Loud

  2. I eddited the bow in photoshop to green as a test. I replaced all of them with the png’s in the data folder compiled and they didnt show
  3. I tried loading my image in the sprite editor then saving it over the ones in the data folder and that didnt work

how do i edit and save a sprite to work

item.title: How To Pack .rscd
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

You don’t unpack or pack the Animations.rscd with the sprite editor. You use the Sprites.rscd with the sprite editor.

You need to decompress the Animations.rscd so it’s readable/editable and once you’ve finished with it, compress it back into .rscd format.

You can do that with a RSCD Compression Tool, or you can simply use 7-zip.

Read full topic
